title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1 EVIDENCE BASE

description.narrative: Output 4.1: Improved evidence base on child poverty, the effectiveness of the current social protection system and the cost, affordability and impact of alternative policy options., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance (Covid), Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: Key ministries have adopted an evidence-informed implementation strategy for providing child grants to reduce child poverty.

mailing-address.narrative: 10th Floor Wisma Metropolitan 2 Jl. Jenderal Sudirman Jakarta 12920

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.1: Improved evidence base on child poverty, the effectiveness of the current social protection system and the cost,affordability and impact of alternative policy options.

description.narrative: Series of empirical evidence has been generated as a basis in building policy dialogue and synergies with relevant ministries such as Ministry of Social Affairs (MoSA), Ministry of National Development Planning (Bappenas), Ministry of Village (MoV), Ministry of Finance (MoF), and Ministry of Home Affairs (MoHA) to leverage child-sensitive social protection programmes. The studies covered topic such as post-distribution monitoring of cash transfer in emergencies for natural disasters and pandemic, budget analysis on sub-national social protection programmes and socio-economic household survey have move forward the discourse towards universal child benefit. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/12/2020
